question.title: Is there a way to add a grading category when creating coursework using the Google Classroom API?
question.body:
When creating coursework via the Google Classroom API, there is a method called setGradeCategory(), which takes a grade category object as input. When setting the grade category, the assignment is created successfully, but no grade category is applied to it. I have to manually go into Google Classroom and set it myself.

For example, if I create a grade category object and pass it in, the assignment is created, but the grade category is still showing as blank when I retrieve the assignment via a GET or look at it in Google Classroom. Below are valid grade category attributes that currently exist for the course I am creating the assignment for:

GradeCategory gradeCategory = new GradeCategory();gradeCategory.setDefaultGradeDenominator(40);gradeCategory.setId("785124763466");gradeCategory.setName("Homework");gradeCategory.setWeight(4000);

CourseWork content = new CourseWork().setTitle(assignmentTitle).setDescription("Test Assignment").setMaterials(materials).setMaxPoints(maxPoints).setGradeCategory(gradeCategory).setWorkType("ASSIGNMENT");

  • The assignment is created successfully.

  • Grade category is blank when viewing the newly created assignment.

answers.body:
The short answer to the question is No. As per REST Resource: courses.courseWork:

object (GradeCategory)

The category that this coursework's grade contributes to. Present only when a category has been chosen for the coursework. May be used in calculating the overall grade.

Read-only.

This indicates that while the Method: courses.courseWork.create takes a grade category object as input, it's expected that no grade category is applied to the created coursework since it's currently designed to be Read-only.

I found Ability to modify gradebookSettings and gradeCategories via course.create and/or course.patch on Google's Issue Tracker, which has a similar issue as yours. You may +1 on it to let Google know you're also requesting the same feature.

My guess is that the reason why the API allows the creation of coursework with the gradeCategory as part of the Request body is because they'll have that added in the future.
